This kit includes a vast array of weaponry – 5 boltguns, 5 power swords, 2 thunder hammers, a frag cannon, 2 storm shields, 2 shotguns, an Infernus heavy bolter, a Stalker-pattern boltgun, 2 power maces and a xenophase blade – along with 7 different heads and 18 Chapter-specific shoulder pads;
- A set of 3 Barbed Venomgorse: a scenery set made up of 3 individual plants. There are 3 trunks and 3 sets of flora, which go together to make the wild and strange-looking plants – there’s a lot of scope for variety, and no two Venomgorse need look the same;
- 11 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 4 Deathwatch Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Deathwatch Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Deathwatch kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating them into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing Kill Team Mordelai, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their deployments;
- 5 datacards for Kill Team Mordelai, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – The Slicing Noose: Drukhari Starter Set
Description:
The Wyches of the Drukhari – also known as Dark Eldar – are vicious and cunning, their fighting style based on a foundation of raw speed. Their Wych Kill Teams can dodge an enemy’s blade as easily as if it were moving through treacle, artfully lopping off limbs and heads as they dance through the melee.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 10 plastic miniatures, a scenery set (with exclusive rules!), and brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- A 10-model Drukhari Kill Team: supplied on purple plastic, these can be used to represent The Slicing Noose or your own Drukhari Kill Team. This kit includes 14 different heads and 10 different bodies (six female variants and four male variants);
- A set of 2 Eldritch Ruins: overgrown and deadly scenery pieces representative of fearful deathworlds. Covered in symbols and entwined with malevolent deathworld flora, they’ll give your games of Kill Team an extra-arcane look;
- 11 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 4 Drukhari Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Drukhari Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Drukhari kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating them into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing The Slicing Noose, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their deployments;
- 10 datacards for The Slicing Noose, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.

Name: BOURPIF
Description:
At the bottom of the vast lands of Mornifle, is a legendary place... The dungeon of BOURPIF!
You are valiant adventurers in search of fame who will cross the dungeon of Bourpif.
Your goal? Get out with the most fame points, i.e. the most cards.
Test your observation skills, dexterity and speed to become a renowned adventurer!
If you don't have any of his skills then ruuuuuuun!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Au fin fond des vastes terres de la Mornifle, se trouve un lieu aussi malfamé que légendaire... Le Donjon de Bourpif !
Mettez à l'épreuve votre sens de l'observation, votre dextérité et votre rapidité pour devenir un aventurier de renommée !
Si vous n'avez aucune de ses compétences alors fuyyyyyeeeezzz !

—description from the publisher

Name: Bugman Battle
Description:
Bugman Battle is The World's First Party Game With BUGS. With simple rules and edgy settings, Bugman Battle enables strong interaction between players. Let’s battle and fill your parties with a fun experience.

The goal of the game is simple: Challenge your opponents and make them eat all of their own bugs!

You will get a funny game, yummy snacks and creative package at one time. Our colorful package is designed referencing the shape of the beetle. Hope you like it!

—description from the designer

Name: Hi-Ways
Description:
The new Connection game. Players sit side by side with the board in front of them. Players choos colors and roll dice to decide who starts. Each Player, alternately, rolls the dice and places a Base-Piece on any one of the Sites defined (bracketed) by the 2 numbers that appear on the dice, either above and below, or on both sides of the Site. If all the player's stock of Base-Pieces is already placed on the Board it is possible to Reposition a Base-Piece to the new Site - according to the throw of the dice. Bases under Bridging-Sections can't be removed. A Player unable to place a Base, because all the Sites of the numbers rolled are captures, loses that turn. A "Double" number on the dice earns the Player another turn. A Player may pass his or her turn if numbers are not suitable.

—user summary

Name: Tor
Description:
The realistic football game for strategists and tacticians. The purpose of the game is to score as many goals as possible through clever play. The players are placed on the corresponding red squares according to the usual football system (4-2-4 or similar). Each team in their half. Each player receives a dice. First is rolled around the ball. Who dices the higher number, receives the ball and thus the impetus. The ball is placed on the base plate of a figure on the center circle. Then both players roll their own die. First, the ball-leading team always pulls, then the opponent. The rolled eyes determine the number of steps of the footballers. The player can draw one or more figures in all directions over free points on the black lines. The defending player can take the ball from the opponent. All football rules such as offside, penalty area, ball, corner or penalty are explained in the rules.

—user summary

Name: The Expanse Boardgame: Doors and Corners
Description:
The Expanse Boardgame: Doors and Corners expansion contains five new modules — Leaders, New Tech, Resource Tokens, Protomolecule, and Variable Setup — that add an engaging element to the strategy and gameplay as players compete for dominance in the world of The Expanse. You can use any number of modules in any combination in conjunction with the base game.

Leaders go with fleets and can add influence when they move with a fleet. New tech allows variety and surprise in what powers are available because when a tech is earned, you have three random choices for that tech. Resource tokens can be spent in several ways, including helping to pay CP costs, adding up to 4 AP to a card, moving up the initiative track, and earning bonus points for having the most at final scoring. Protomolecule adds a new scoring opportunity. Variable set-up allows fleets and influence to be placed anywhere at the start of the game.

Name: Wort Roulette
Description:
A letter game with luck (roulette) and creativity, quick thinking and imagination. One of the players turns the roulette wheel and throws in all 6 bullets. The letters, groups of letters and free fields marked by the 6 balls when the wheel is stationary are called by the game master. All players now occupy the corresponding fields on their board with their chips. Freifelder allow the choice and use of any letter. Now we turn the hourglass and each player now tries as quickly as possible to form a common noun before the clock expires. The more letters or groups in a word, the higher the scoring. The winner is the one who has scored the most points after an agreed playing time or after a certain number of laps.

—user summary

Name: Raetia
Description:
Germania 250 CE

When the Roman province of Raetia was invaded by Alemanni tribes, refugees fled through forests and mountains to the safety of the city of Brigantium?

Fast moving race and dice game.

A die roll determines the movement of your refugees over land tiles. Your supplies should be used carefully to change your luck. Will you have the bribe needed to get past the guards at the city gates?

RAETIA IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

—description from the designer

Name: Molins de Rei. 21-12-1808
Description:
The battle of Molins de Rey was a battle that took place on december, 21st 1808 near Llobregat River close to Barcelona (Spain). It opposed French forces of general St.Cyr to the Spanish forces of general von Reading.

This game would be a Jours de Gloire series game.

The Spanish army tries to maintain a position apparently strong but with a weak flank. The French must try to coordinate a flank attack with a frontal attack to try to capture the entire enemy army. Historically the Spaniards were defeated but they avoided being surrounded.

The different divisions are activated by chits drawn from a cup, but the activation does not guarantee that the player does everything he wants.

The turns are 1 hour and the game lasts a maximum of 10 turns.

Rules: Jours de Gloire 
Scale: 1 hex. = 330 m - 1 counter = 1 regiment/battaillon
Map size: A2

Spanish army: 15.000 men - 21 counters
French army: 25.000 men - 21 Counters
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Town League Hockey
Description:
In Town League Hockey, YOU are a newly arrived General Manager of a team in the Town Hockey League.
Somewhere in the far north... hidden among the great Canadian wilderness... where the snow falls year round, the bitter cold bites your face, and the sound of the wolves in the forest lull you to sleep at night... lies the hidden hamlet of Town.

Town is a humble, kind, hard-working community, but once a year, the people of Town become rivals... and they compete in an annual hockey tournament for the prestigious Frosty Cup! In Town League Hockey, you will control either the Gold or Silver team and guide your players to the ultimate prize!

Town League Hockey is a mid-weight game about playing a match of hockey. It was created to fill this niche because I found all hockey board games were either very light or very heavy. Town League Hockey is simple enough to learn in a few minutes, but deep enough that you will be mulling over your choices as you decide how to respond to on-ice events, where to skate with the puck to get the best shot, and when to rest or play your best players.

—description from the designer

Name: This Is Only a Test
Description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s a lovely sunny morning with Dad smoking his pipe and reading the Sunday paper, Mom cooking bacon in the kitchen, Billy shooting everything in sight with his Yellow Flyer BB gun™ and Sally combing her porcelain dolly’s hair.  But then the silence is broken by the blare of the local air-raid siren.  Who knows what this could mean?

Will the Reds invade? 
Will the Atomic Bomb Drop?
Or, perhaps, THIS IS ONLY A TEST?

Find out as you and your friends jockey for supplies and nudge the doomsday clock ever closer to the brink!

GAMEPLAY

"This Is Only A Test" is a pre-Apocalyptic game of civil defense. Panic is building and you must negotiate for supplies in anticipation of three unique endings. bomb. Players can use there actions to investigate the timeline, or (better yet) manipulate it to press for there preferred ending by visiting City Hall.  Each location in City Hall allows players to manipulate the timeline in different ways.  Want the bomb to drop?  Visit the Mayor's office and start adding Bomb cards to the timeline!   Here's the catch those same actions are used to gather supplies to win.  So, while you're out ensuring the bomb will drop, the other players may be gathering consumables to put in there fallout shelter!

When the game ends, the player who has prepared the best, for the correct ending will win! So, if the Atomic bomb drops, you had better have the most supplies in your Fallout shelter, but if the Reds invade, self-defense items will rule the day.  What happens if the Bomb doesn't drop, or the Reds don't invade?  Well, This is Only a Test, of course!  And, the golden rule applies - the person with the most glorious riches wins!

WHY IT'S UNIQUE

"This Is Only A Test" uses a unique timeline mechanic that keeps the players in suspense as the game races towards an unknown conclusion at an unknown time.  The timeline may contain the Red Invasion card or the Atomic Bomb card.  Then again, it may not.

WHO IT'S FOR

If you love suspense and hidden information with a dash of bluffing, this is the fallout shelter for you.  Great for 1-4 friends who love to outwit one another in 45-60 mins.

THE AIR RAID SIREN IS SOUNDING!

Will you stockpile heaps of supplies, defend yourself to the teeth, or simply profit from other’s paranoia? The Red Army looms! The A-bomb is armed!  Is it time to duck and cover? Or perhaps..."This Is Only A Test".

Name: Draconis Invasion: Hero Pledge Promo Cards
Description:
Cards that were exclusive to the Hero level pledge

6x Resurrection
6x Summoning
6x Consuming Fire

6x Beast Master
6x Death Angel
6x Berserker (Secret Set)
6x Sky Rider (Secret Set)

1x Blood Dragon (Secret Set)

Name: Draconis Invasion: Add-On Pack
Description:
30 Defender and Action cards from the 2015 Kickstarter. They were later available as an add-on during the Kickstarter for Draconis Invasion: Wrath.

Includes:
6x Wandering Sword
6x Varcolac
6x Against All Odds
6x Spirit of A Hero
6x Dragon Crusade

Name: Draconis Invasion: Victory Pledge Promo Cards
Description:
6x Transmutation
6x Born of Flame
6x Reanimation
6x Forbidden Quest
6x Dark Forces (Secret Set)

6x Golden Warriors
6x Frost Knight
6x Tree Ent
6x Iron Guardian (Secret Set)
6x Black Sword (Secret Set)

6x Fallen Sky
6x Strange Magic (Secret Set)

Name: Draconis Invasion: Warrior Pledge Promo Cards
Description:
These cards were originally available as part of the Warrior pledge level during the original Kickstarter for Draconis Invasion.

They were later made available as an add-on during the Draconis Invasion: Wrath Kickstarter.

Includes:
6x Call to Arms
6x Soul Flame
6x Panda Scout
6x Dragon Hunter
6x Elder Stone (Foil)

Name: Scythe: Encounters
Description:
In June 2018, Scythe fans were invited to make a design for ONE encounter card using specific art. Jamey reviewed the submissions, selected his favorites (often mixing and matching various submissions), and developed them. Now the Scythe Encounters promo boxed set is a reality!

Scythe Encounters is a boxed set of 32 brand-new promo encounter cards. These cards feature a number of innovations in the encounter system. We recommend that you play with them on their own for a few games; after that you can shuffle them into the regular encounter deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Land of the Two Rivers: Iraq War
Description:
Land of the Two Rivers is a game of the Iraq War in the post-invasion period starting roughly in Summer 2003. By this point Saddam's government had disintegrated and fateful decisions had already been made regarding official U.S. policy towards powerful factions within Iraq. The players are faced with the situation as it existed at that time, as the Sunni insurgency was building momentum, the Shia were taking advantage of the chaos to flex their long-suppressed muscle, and everyone was realizing there were insufficient U.S. forces to police the entire country. Regional and global entities like Syria, Turkey, Iran and Al Qaeda were attempting to shift events in their favor. The game does not provide the ability to alter what had already been done up to that point, but each player has options on how to conduct operations going forward.

The game is designed for three players, representing:

1. United States, British, Other Coalition, and Iraqi National Forces (INF)
2. Sunnis (Iraqi Sunnis and their sponsors in the larger Sunni world)
3. Shiites (Iraqi Shia and their sponsors in Iran)

The U.S./Coalition objective is to stand up the Iraqi army in sufficient strength and effectiveness to control the majority of the country, with a small number of supporting U.S./Coalition troops.

The Sunni and Shiite objectives are to gain control over enough of the population to give them a decisive advantage in the eventual political and economic solution that must one day be achieved.

Players are free to cooperate and make (or break) any agreements they wish. However, there can only be one winner, so ultimately one player must outmaneuver the other two.

The game has rules for U.S. Morale and Commitment similar to Nick Karp's classic "Vietnam: 1965-1975", training of Iraqi National Forces (INF), Ground Attacks, IED Cells, Ambushes, Air Strikes, Al Qaeda unpredictability, Suicide Attacks, Coalition country withdrawals, Civilian Casualties, and more. There are sub-systems for the hunt for High Value Targets (HVTs), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMDs), and Infiltration of support from regional players.

-description from designer

Name: Serpents
Description:
Serpents is a tarot sized, secret identity, card game. Serpents puts a fresh spin on classic secret-identity games like Mafia and Werewolf. Play using our rules out of the box, or throw them out and use your own. Our team has taken measures to ensure this deck is flexible enough to play a range of unique hidden-identity games — known or as yet unwritten — and allows you to cater any existing version to your liking. Mix and match your favorite roles and start lying to your closest friends and family.

One player will serve as The Fortune Teller. Remaining players will either be Innocents, striving collectively for survival using logic and deduction, or Serpents, fork-tongued deceivers, eliminating travelers from the game using pretense and lies. Only the Fortune Teller knows the true identity of each player. He alone will attend the players on their journey, acting as both moderator and story-teller.

Name: Infinity: Operation Coldfront
Description:
"On the frozen steppes of Dawn, ALEPH has deployed one of her forward bases to fight against the Combined Army invaders. However, the Ariadnans suspect that it is just the first stage of a plot of the AI to increase her influence over their planet, and they will not allow that!"

This box contains all the miniatures, rules, and terrain you need to play Infinity Operation: Coldfront, and introduce you to Infinity 3rd edition.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mr. Cabbagehead is Away and Neddance Saves the Day
Description:
A solitaire postcard game designed by Todd Sanders.

"Mr. Cabbagehead is away on one of his holidays. Neddance has stayed behind to protect Mr. C’s garden from his annoying neighbours and to make sure they do not leave with any vegetables. But alas, for each neighbour she sends on their way, the others become even more determined to snatch a vegetable. Neddance is perfectly polite with all the neighbours but even she has a limit to her patience and only so many excuses she can divert them with."

In Mr. Cabbagehead is Away and Neddance Saves the Day, you play the role of Neddance, trying to defend Mr. Cabbagehead's garden from his ever-so-tiresome Neighbours.

To play the game you need to supply two dice and a standard deck of cards.

In order to win Neddance must send away each of the 8 Neighbours before her Patience reaches 0.

There are 3 phases in each round.

Phase 1: Neighbours Move Through The Garden.
Roll one die and the result is the total number of spaces one or more Neighbours will move towards Neddance.

Phase 2: Neighbours Now Pester Neddance, While She Tries To Maintain Her Composure.
Each Neighbour that reaches Neddance will Pester her in turn by rolling one die plus one more die for each Neighbour already sent away. Then Neddance must keep her Composure and send the Neighbour away by playing cards with higher total value, otherwise she loses Patience. If her Patience reaches 0 the game is lost.

After sending away certain Neighbours, Neddance gains confidence and can make more excuses in order to send the rest of the Neighbours away.

Phase 3: Neddance Is On The Move, Looking For Neighbours To Send Away.
If Neddance has less than 3 cards left, she regains all her discarded cards and then plays 1-3 cards in order to move.

At the end of each round Neddance's Patience is decreased by one.

Name: Oddbods Go-Kards
Description:
Oddbods Go-Kards is a new take on the 'family' game genre. It's a family game for 'gamer' families with multiple games in one box.

At its most basic, it is a play-a-card-and-move-the-meeple party race game that lasts 10 to 15 minutes and can be picked up in a few minutes even by small children. The game has players perform fun real-life social challenges to reap in-game rewards.

In its more advanced forms, it features tactical take-that and power-up cards, modular and constructable tracks, a variety of rule-altering pit-stops and an emergent power-up marketplace. Players can setup and duke it out in races that take up to an hour or even more to finish.

The game is based on Oddbods, a Singaporean-British CGI-animated comedy television series produced by the Singapore-based studio One Animation.

The series focuses on seven different, sometimes battling characters called the Oddbods - Fuse, Pogo, Zee, Jeff, Bubbles, Slick and Newt.

-description from designer

Name: Naše století
Description:
Our century is an original game for all who love good fun! You practice your logical thinking, memory and concentration. It is intended for 2-6 players and the length of one game is usually 30 minutes or more. You can examine your knowledge in five basic areas: the Czech Century, food, culture, places of interest and various.
The game was released on the occasion of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of Czechoslovakia by Albi and Albert.

Game preparation: Put the game board onto the table. Each player takes a meeple of one color and places it on START. Place the decks with knowledge and tipping questions on the marked place on the plan.
Game objective: The game objective is to pass all the fields on the board and the first to reach the finish field.
Game progress: The youngest player starts and then the players turn clockwise. The player on the left of the drawer draws the card from the top of the question pile. The player on the turn throws a dice and the player on his left reads the question and three possible answers from a topic whose color matches the color of the dice. If the color is purple, the player can choose the topic himself. If he answers correctly, he moves his meeple forward, if he is wrong, he stands.

Name: The European War
Description:
This a rare and unusual Japanese game about the European theatre published during WWI.

It is a roll-and-move game of maneuver for 2-6 players, pitting Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy against France, Britain and Russia.

The former start in the upper left of the board, and the latter in the lower right. Various tracks connect the two, and the objective is to capture the opponent's headquarters. Each of the countries starts with two playing pieces, whose initial placement space is determined by a die roll.
